summary: ON 5/1/03 I WAS DRIVING MY CAR AT LOW SPEEDS AND IT FELT LIKE IT WAS LOSING POWER AND WAS GOING TO CUT OFF. I APPLIED THE GAS AND THE CAR CONTINUED TO RUN.  I DROVE TO MY HOME AND TURNED OFF THE IGNITION. WHEN I TRIED TO START THE CAR AGAIN, IT WOULD NOT START.  ON 05/02/03, THE CAR STARTED BUT NOT AS QUICKLY AS NORMAL.  I TOOK THE CAR TO A LOCAL AUTO REPAIR SHOP AND DESCRIBED THE ABOVE SITUATION.  THEY DIAGNOSED THE PROBLEM AS A DEFECTIVE BATTERY.  THEY REPLACED THE BATTERY. ON 5/6/03, I HAD THE SAME INTERMITTENT STARTING PROBLEM.  I TOOK THE CAR TO ANOTHER SHOP.  THEY TOLD ME THE PROBLEM WAS A BAD ALTERNATOR.  THE CAR HAS  ABOUT 65,170 MILES ON IT.  PRIOR TO THAT ON  07/31/00, THE ALTERNATOR WAS REPLACED AT 47,662 MILES. PRIOR TO THAT THE ALTERNATOR WAS REPLACED UNDER WARRANTY ON 08/06/98 AT 28,515.   THIS SEEMS EXCESSIVE.   *NLM   THE CONSUMER IS  HAVING ALTERNATOR PROBLEMS WITH HER VEHICLE.  *TC
